section.title: Description
section.b: This step is used to locate a form button and then click it.
section.pre:
Currently tested and thus officially supported are the following variations of buttons:
<input type="submit" .../>
<input type="image" .../>
<input type="button" .../>
<input type="reset" .../>
<button .../>
If neither 'label', 'name', 'htmlid', nor 'xpath' is specified, the first button found is clicked (in document order, looking first in the current form, if any).

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description of this test step.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The NAME attribute for the button of interest. Name has lower precedence than htmlId.

attribute.name: fieldIndex
attribute.description: The index (starting with 0) of the button to click within the buttons having the specified label and/or name. Useful for instance to distinguish two buttons having the same name.

attribute.name: x
attribute.description: Optional X coordinate of click within an image button. If set, Y coordinate must also be set.

attribute.name: y
attribute.description: Optional Y coordinate of click within an image button. If set, X coordinate must also be set.

attribute.name: xpath
attribute.description: The xpath of the button to click.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: The label of the button to click. This is the text representation for a text button or the alt attribute for an image button

attribute.name: htmlId
attribute.description: The html id of the button to click.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: A username that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Typically only needed on the first step of any accessing a secure site. Required if password is specified.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: A password that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Required if username is specified.

attribute.name: save
attribute.description: A shorthand: save='prefixName' is the same as savePrefix='prefixName' saveResponse='true'.

attribute.name: savePrefix
attribute.description: A name prefix can be specified for making a permanent copy of received responses. A unique number and the file extension (depending on the MIME-Type) will be appended. The resultpath attribute of the <config> element is used for determining the location of the saved result.
attribute.required: no, default is the 'savePrefix' parameter as specified in <config>.

attribute.name: saveResponse
attribute.description: Whether to make a permanent copy of received responses. Overrides the default value set in the <config> element.
